Increase heat to medium-high; bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 2 hours, stirring occasionally. Discard bay leaves before serving.

Zucchini Spice Cake Fruits and Vegetables Vegetables Squash This zucchini spice recipe is a dense cake reminiscent of carrot cake. I created the dish to make use of a bumper crop of zucchini and to get my kids to eat more fruits and veggies without them knowing it. I frequently add an extra cup of stir-ins — raisins, flaked coconut, and walnuts or pecans are favorites. 3 cups grated unpeeled zucchini 3 cups all-purpose flour 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda 1 teaspoon baking powder 2 cups white sugar 1 cup brown sugar 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon ¼ teaspoon ground cloves ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg ½ teaspoon salt 4 eggs 1 cup unsweetened applesauce ¾ cup vegetable oil 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease one 9x13-inch pan. AllRecipes/Qi Ai Place grated zucchini in a colander and set aside to drain. AllRecipes/Qi Ai Whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder, white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and salt in a large bowl until well blended. AllRecipes/Qi Ai Beat eggs, applesauce, oil, and vanilla in a separate bowl until smooth. Fold in flour mixture, then stir in zucchini. AllRecipes/Qi Ai Pour batter into the prepared pan. AllRecipes/Qi Ai Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 45 to 55 minutes. Allow to cool completely before cutting. AllRecipes/Qi Ai Tips If you would like, add up to 1 cup of raisins, flaked coconut, walnuts, or pecans, when you add the zucchini in Step 3.

Tomato Pie Dip Appetizers and Snacks Dips and Spreads Cheese Dips and Spreads Hot Cheese Dip Recipes Very creamy and so flavorful! Jump to recipe A Southern classic reimagined, this irresistible Tomato Pie Dip is perfect for any occasion of the season. With layers of ripe, juicy tomatoes, fresh basil, and a creamy three-cheese spread, this crowd-pleasing dip brings all the comfort of a traditional tomato pie straight to your appetizer spread. “The dip is very creamy and so flavorful with the tomatoes. Basil lightens up the palate quite a bit, and it doesn’t taste greasy,” said test kitchen cross-tester Renu Dhar . “It’s quite fun and very communal.” cooking spray 3 red beefsteak tomatoes , cored 1 teaspoon kosher salt , divided 1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese , softened 1/2 cup mayonnaise 1/2 cup chopped Vidalia onion (from 1 small [5 ounce] onion) 1/4 cup loosely packed fresh basil leaves , cut into thin slices, plus more for garnish 1/2 cup shredded low-moisture part-skim mozzarella cheese 1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese 1 1/2 teaspoons hot sauce (such as Tabasco) 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce 1/2 teaspoon onion powder 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper 1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese crostini toast Gather all ingredients. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly coat a 10-inch skillet with cooking spray; set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Trim top and bottom of 1 of the tomatoes; cut into 6 (1/4-inch-thick) slices; place slices between 2 layers of paper towels; set aside. Seed and chop remaining tomatoes; place in a colander set over a medium bowl; sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of the salt, tossing gently to distribute salt. Let stand for 10 minutes. Lightly pat tomatoes dry with a clean kitchen towel; discard liquid. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios While tomatoes are resting, stir together cream cheese, mayonnaise, onion, basil, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, onion powder, black pepper, 3/4 cup of the Cheddar cheese, and remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl until thoroughly combined; gently fold in chopped tomatoes until evenly distributed. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Transfer tomato mixture to prepared skillet, spreading it into an even layer. Sprinkle evenly with remaining 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese and top with sliced tomatoes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is fully melted and edges are bubbling, 25 to 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Garnish with additional basil and serve immediately with crostini. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Peanut Butter and Honey Sandwich Main Dishes Sandwich Recipes Honey, peanut butter, and unsalted butter are mixed together and spread onto bread to make a simple, tasty, and delicious childhood sandwich favorite. 2 tablespoons peanut butter 1 teaspoon honey 1 teaspoon unsalted butter, softened 2 slices bread Stir peanut butter, honey, and butter together in a bowl until smooth. Spread on one of the bread slices. Close sandwich with remaining bread slice.

Best Zucchini Casserole Vegetables Squash Summer Squash Zucchini This is a creative, unusual casserole that's one of my grandmother's favorites. It combines zucchini and bell pepper with Cheddar cheese, spices, and crispy cornflakes. Bread crumbs can be used in place of cornflakes. 8 cups diced zucchini 1 red bell pepper, chopped 1 cup cornflakes cereal 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese ½ cup olive oil 1 teaspoon dried basil 2 large eggs, beaten salt and pepper to taste Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly oil a 9x13-inch baking dish. AllRecipes/Diana Chistruga Combine zucchini, bell pepper, cornflakes, cheese, oil, basil, and eggs in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste. AllRecipes/Diana Chistruga Spread evenly into the prepared baking dish. AllRecipes/Diana Chistruga Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown, about 45 minutes. AllRecipes/Diana Chistruga

Zucchini Chocolate Chip Cake Fruits and Vegetables Vegetables Squash This zucchini chocolate chip cake is very moist and chocolaty. It is best served warm with whipped cream on top and reheats well. ½ cup milk 1 teaspoon distilled white vinegar 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour ¼ cup unsweetened cocoa powder 1 teaspoon baking soda ½ teaspoon baking powder 1 ½ cups white sugar ½ cup butter, softened ½ cup vegetable oil 2 large eggs 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 2 cups grated zucchini 1 cup chocolate chips Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking dish. AllRecipes/Qi Ai Combine milk and vinegar in a large bowl; let stand to sour milk, about 5 minutes. AllRecipes/Qi Ai Meanwhile, combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and baking powder in a medium bowl. AllRecipes/Qi Ai Add sugar, butter, oil, eggs, and vanilla to soured milk; beat until incorporated. Add flour mixture; stir until just combined. Fold in zucchini. AllRecipes/Qi Ai Pour batter into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. AllRecipes/Qi Ai Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of cake comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. AllRecipes/Qi Ai
